Date and Time¶

Description for data selector to be added here

Source Code¶

This module defines a data class used to process features by time. It now has only minor method which are intended to have more methods added by time. As of today (08.05.2020), it has the following methods

  • rolling_mean_plot: a plot for visualizing time data

  • rel_plot: a plot for visualizing time data

Furthermore, it has code to generate features out of date time data. Note that all of those classes are using the BaseEstimator and TransformerMixin classes from the scikit-learn bases classes. In order to use the fit_transform implemented by the scikit-learn, every single Feature Transformer needs to have a fit and transform method. The fit methods returns the object itself and is therefore not documented

class date_and_time.DateByAnalyzer(data: Union[str, pandas.core.frame.DataFrame], x_cols: Union[str, Sequence[str]], date_cols: Union[str, Sequence[str]])[source]¶

Bases: baseattrs.BaseStats

  • x_cols – the different columns which are to be analyzed by time

  • date_cols – the date columns.

class date_and_time.TimeDifference(x_time: str, y_time: str, days: bool = True, seconds: bool = False, microseconds: bool = False, nanoseconds: bool = False, components: bool = False)[source]¶

Bases: sklearn.base.BaseEstimator, sklearn.base.TransformerMixin

Returns the difference in time between two different time columns.

__init__(x_time: str, y_time: str, days: bool = True, seconds: bool = False, microseconds: bool = False, nanoseconds: bool = False, components: bool = False)[source]¶

Initializes a Time Difference Calculator object to fit_transform a DataFrame The following return columns can be retrieved:

  • days: the difference of days between the two columns

  • seconds: the difference of seconds between the two columns

  • microseconds: the difference of microseconds between the two columns

  • `` nanoseconds``: the difference of nanoseconds between the two columns

  • components: the difference expressed in date time components

Parameters

  • x_time (str) – first time column

  • y_time (str) – second time column

  • days (bool) – a flag indicating if a column with the difference in days is returned

  • seconds (bool) – a flag indicating if a column with the difference in seconds is returned

  • microseconds (bool) – a flag indicating if a column with the difference in microseconds is returned

  • nanoseconds (bool) – a flag indicating if a column with the difference in nanoseconds is returned

  • components – a flag indicating if a column with the difference in datetime components is returned

fit(X, y=None, **kwargs) → date_and_time.TimeDifference[source]¶
transform(X: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame[source]¶

Transforms the DataFrame by creating new columns yielding the time difference. Iterates over all boolean arguments and applies a transformation is the boolean flag is set to True.

Parameters

X – The DataFrame for which the time difference between x_time and y_time is yielded

Returns

Derives Time features properties in the DataFrame column

__init__(time_features: Union[str, Sequence], delete_original_column: bool = True, month: bool = True, year: bool = True, day: bool = True, dayofweek: bool = True, dayofyear: bool = True, hour: bool = True, minute: bool = True, week: bool = True, weekofyear: bool = True, quarter: bool = True, is_weekend: bool = True, is_leap_year: bool = True, is_month_end: bool = True, is_month_start: bool = True, is_quarter_start: bool = True, is_quarter_end: bool = True, is_year_start: bool = True, is_year_end: bool = True)[source]¶

Initializes a Time Feature creator object.

Parameters

  • delete_original_column (bool) – a flag indicating if the original column is dropped from the resulting DataFrame

  • month (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s month is derived

  • year (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s year is derived

  • day (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s day is derived

  • dayofweek (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s day of the week is derived

  • dayofyear (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s day of the year is derived

  • hour (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s hour is derived

  • minute (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s minute is derived

  • week (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s week is derived

  • is_weekend (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime is during a weekend

  • weekofyear (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s week of year is derived

  • quarter (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s quarter is derived

  • is_leap_year (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is a leap year

  • is_month_end (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the month’s last day

  • is_month_start (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the month’s first day

  • is_quarter_start (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the quarter’s first day

  • is_quarter_end (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the quarter’s last day

  • is_year_start (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the year’s first day

  • is_year_end (bool) – a flag indicating if the datetime’s derives, if it is the year’s last day
